name: Becca Bishop
text:
I left Alabama because of the narrow mindset of people who work and shop at this store. They say one thing and do another. The only reason they gave me a refund was because a woman basically verbally attacked me in their store for requesting a refund and couldn’t keep her “Christian” mouth shut about what she thought about me requesting a refund.

And their feigned polite attitude afterward was more offensive because they made their views clear as they allowed the customer to verbally harass me the whole time.

The woman called me “entitled” for demanding a refund (after being told I could return). Nowhere on my ticket did it mention no returns either. And here’s what I should’ve said: I am 100% entitled to my money. If a small business has an employee that makes a mistake and tells me that I can return an item then they should honor me as a customer and allow me to return the item regardless of what their policy is. Yes, I am entitled to my money back. And an apology to be quite honest, instead of the back-and-forth willy-nilly excuses from their employees about how they just choose not to return things.

If it were my store I would’ve asked the customer who chose to open her mouth and begin harassing to leave the store or shut their mouth. Because it was uncalled for. But instead they sat there with a smile on their face as they listened.

It’s a shame what this country has become that everyone feels that they need to have an opinion about everyone else’s life and state it. It’s also a backwards Christian who professes their Christianity is what led them to SHAME someone else based on their own personal view in public. Because that’s absolutely NOT what the cross was for.

I was disgusted once again by Alabamians today. And this store, which clearly values money over customers, has lost mine in the future.

***Most items are NEW w/ TAGS or barely worn clothes! All items are in GREAT CONDITION.*** (size 29-32 in mens/boys pants. Men’s size Small & Medium in shirts. Some “boys XL 18-20” in dress shirts as well.)

This is my brother’s first year at West Point (go Army!). He isn’t allowed to come home very much these next 4 years, so we have cleaned out his entire closet & have taken ALL of his clothes to Fashion Exchange in Athens, AL!

These clothes will only be allowed to stay on the floor for just 3 months. Go check them out soon!

text: Got the dresses I went there for. Great selection. I did end up feeling a bit rushed to finish up with the dressing room so someone else could use it..... Which I get, however.... I rushed up my decision, made the purchase and while still sitting in the parking lot the teenagers I had hurried up for were walking back out to their vehicles with no purchase made.......wouldn't stop me from shopping again!

resp.text: Susan, we are so sorry you felt rushed, that was not our intent. It does get crazy busy during prom season so we do our best to give everyone equal time in the dressing rooms. Thank you so much for your business and we appreciate your understanding. We’re always striving to improve so thank you for the feedback!

name: Lisa Potter
text: Don’t lie on the phone and say you don’t do consignment when it’s right on your website. Also, try not to sound so rude when answering the phone like it takes every ounce of you to be kind.

resp.text:
Lisa, we’re sorry you had a negative experience. We do consignment yes, but we don’t purchase items outright. Consignment means you still own the item (we don’t buy it from you) and then when it sells you get a percentage of the sale. So sorry for the confusion. We also apologize for coming across as rude, we were short handed today with people waiting to check out and our
human-ness must have come through, thank you for understanding and for your review. Have a great weekend!!

resp.text: Hi Meshay P, we aim to deliver a great experience but as humans we sometimes miss the mark. We’ll strive to do better. Have a great day!

name: J&P Conner
text: We bought a table and chairs from this store a couple months ago.  After we got it home within  one week a leg gave way on one of the chairs and yesterday another chair broke.  You cannot put any weight on the edge of the table, like pushing yourself up from the table, or it will flip. My husband tried to fix the chair legs but it looks to be stripped from the screws.  I called and the owner said she could have her husband look at it but nothing else could be done because they were a consignment and not the owners.  She was very nice but We know the chairs cannot be repaired. We don't,  even feel safe sitting in them.  Although I know they will not reinburse us or give us a credit I am still very disappointed.  I guess it's our fault we didn't look at the set more carefully for quality.

resp.text: I understand that you are disappointed. I offered you on the phone to let my husband look at the chairs to see if there was something he could do. I requested photos of the table and chairs to see what we could do. I don't understand giving a bad rating when I offered to help. My husband and I don't know what table you purchased without the pictures I requested.

name: Marykay Causey
text: I have done business with this place since they opened years ago but never again. This past Fall, I took a box of clothes that I no longer needed and went through them piece by piece with the owner. He chose the items that I left there on consignment, including a pair of Juicy Couture jeans, a Free People sweater and several other name brand items. I called them around Christmas time to get a check and was told that they had no record of my items. I figured there was a mistake made with my account so I went by to straighten it out. The girl called the current owner and was told to tell me that my items weren't put under my account because they weren't good enough to sell. Incredulously, I explained that the owner hand selected my things. She tells me that man is no longer an owner. I really needed that money. I wish I would have taken my things somewhere else. Next time I will. As far as I'm concerned, they stole my clothes.

Love this shop!!!! Fashion and shopping is so expensive these days. This shop you can stay in fashion and still have money left over you can go out to eat. The employees are all so friendly. name: Sara He
text: So, I called Second Edition yesterday and was elated to find out that they closed at 6 PM unlike the rest of the Hertha's locations that close at 5. I work in West Mobile and live in Summerdale, so I hustled across the bay and arrived in the shop around 4:49, ugh traffic is the worst most days. When I called the shop, I informed the person working that 1. I was coming from West Mobile 2. I would be late but would be there before 6 3. I was really excited they closed at 6 4. I couldn't wait to check out the store! So, I walked in and was of course, I am greeted by an extremely RUDE young lady (do I call her a lady?) who blurts out, "WE ARE ALREADY CLOSED." To which I am like, "Huh? I thought ya'll closed at 6." To which she retracted her statement, "Well, we're not closed, you can look around," but she is counting the money out of her drawer. I said, "I have a card..." No response.  Anyway, completely threw me off. So I looked around for maybe 4 minutes and was honestly just pissed the entire time. How is that a way to greet someone? I just hurried to get here AFTER I called to let you know I was coming, had someone almost crash into me on the way, and you have the audacity to be so extremely rude? I will not give this place any business and neither should you. I will take my business to the other Hertha's locations that are apparently run by Second Edition's ex-wife or something. I am sure that the young women there are much more pleasant and would not turn customers away, nor close their stores early.

name: Laura
text:
We had a great experience here. Got a really nice armoire for less than we expected. The lady working the register helped to carry it down the stairs and get it in the vehicle without the slightest complaint.

I think their business model is pretty cool: they rent spaces within the shop to people who sell stuff, and they have one central register. You don't have to meet with the seller or anything, the stuff is just there all the time. With the current sellers, it's mostly furniture, with some home décor, some Alabama football-themed items, and a little clothing (looks new and "vintage"). There's two levels, so be sure to look at all of it!

name: Morgan B
text: We tried to go to Alford Avenue antiques, the first address online was wrong and we ended up at an abandoned building in the middle of nowhere. Tried a second address for Alford and ended up here at the Vintage Shoppes, which come to find out from reading online IS Alford Avenue Antiques. Alford had operating hours posted online which stated they are open until 7,  whereas the Vintage Shoppes apparently close at 5 now. Even still, we got there before 5 and it was already closed, although there was a huge OPEN sign in the window with a tiny in comparison CLOSED sign near it. Altogether frustrating experience, store might be fine we wouldn’t know.

resp.text: Since COVID, Updating the hours across the Internet has been a challenge. Thank you for taking the time to visit The Vintage Shoppes today and we hope that you can find time to visit again in the future. Once inside, you will find curated spaces by Alford Avenue antiques as well as other vendors throughout the space. Sorry that your Experience today made you give one star. The vendors at the vintage Shoppes work very diligently to provide good merchandise and good service to shoppers. We would all like to think we are far better than one star and hope that you would reconsider your rating of this small business.

name: laurie lawson
text: Fun vintage shops with great lighting and a plethora of merchandise. It is all displayed in a way that is not overpowering and the store is designed that walking through the little rooms make you feel like you are discovering treasures at every turn. In fact we discovered and purchased this adorable vintage hat for my niece.

resp.text: Thank you for visiting today. Customers like you and others we welcome at The Vintage Shoppes are the lifeblood of a small business.  We appreciate the warm review. Thank you. Please come again soon! Enjoy the hat! #ShopSmall

name: Katrina Hunkapiller
text: Very unique, gorgeous selection to fit any home/style for great prices! Loved how organized it was and the art gallery/furniture store set up and design. I went to find another item to meet the $20 minimum to pay with card and ended up going home with two items I love!

resp.text: Katrina, thank you so much for taking the time to visit today. The Vintage Shoppes and it’s Vendor’s work diligently to ensure our guests have a wonderful shopping experience. Times are challenging now and every transaction and every customer visit is extremely important. Thank you for being an important part of our survival. Thank you so very much for taking the time to support this small business. Stay safe!

name: Sherika Heard
text: I visited this place with my husband and small child, I was highly satisfied with my purchase but my husband felt that the customer service did not come off as pleasant. He was asked for an ID for a $20 purchase which he felt was unnecessary. Without inquiring about why we had to show ID, the cashier began to state that it was mandatory for all card purchases. Unfortunately my husband does not feel comfortable spending any more money at this store.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing. Apologies if the delivery of our ID requirement could have been softer. There is a sign posted at the register alerting shoppers that purchases must be greater than $20 to swipe and the name on the card must match your photo ID. As retailers we prevent fraud far more often than many consumers realize and we take every precaution to prevent it from happening at The Vintage Shoppes. It is unfortunate that you decided that our commitment to your security warranted 3 stars. This small business deserves more than 3 stars just as you deserve for every small shop to regard security as high as sales. For the same reason your husband “does not feel comfortable” shopping in The Vintage Shoppes, there are many more who shop with us because they appreciate our diligence.  This small business appreciates you as we wish you safety, blessings and prosperity.

name: Lynda Pierce
text: Great experience shopping today. Much more everything than I expected. Great selection, great prices, great pieces. Could not bring anything home today but I am still thinking about my visit so I guess I will return tomorrow to purchase something I had my eye on. Most places like this are a little grimy but not this one. It’s a new place in my rotation!

name: Theresa LoRusso

However, the items I got didn’t ring up to $20, so I was told they would only take cash or I couldn’t make the purchase. Only all I had on me was credit cards and I had an afternoon appointment so I didn’t have time to go to an atm and come back. I’m really disappointed. It would be nice for first time customers to get a little grace on the first purchase since I had no idea I would need to bring cash. Or maybe have more signage around the store? The only sign was at the checkout counter and the writing was so small, I didn’t notice it until I was finished shopping.

resp.text: Thank you so much for taking time to visit the store. As with any business The Vintage Shoppes has a minimum of $20 for us to swipe anything which is posted in a nice little frame at the register. It’s unfortunate that this upset you so that you have given the place three stars because of that but we hope that you might come and visit us again in the future. Small businesses have to take steps of this manner to keep it going one more day. This small business appreciates your support.

She makes up prices at the register because her employees don't know how to price items.  Her employees are also very unprofessional and she blames them for whenever something goes wrong.  It is not the employees fault, but the business owner should be held responsible. Her estate sales are very unorganized, and you will find consistent reviews noting this as well. Please if you are working with Signature Estate Sales, please note that you are also working with Alford Avenue Antiques and NOW The Vintage Shoppes, where you will find she has scammed many indivduals who did not know she was operating under two (now three) different business names. She must be stopped from deceiving others before this all goes too far. I feel sorry for anyone who has fell victim to her scams.

text: I took multiple large bag of clothes in there for her to look at, and as soon as she saw a Fringe Consignment Shop receipt that was left in a bag she stopped looking completely and said she couldn't take any of it. She didn't even look through 95% of my items. If she can't be bothered to look through the stuff I brought there, I can't be bothered to shop there anymore.

resp.text:
As a former employee of Fringe, I have experience with their policies and hold the same standards for items that I accept.  Basically, I accept current styles, in good condition, that I have an immediate need for in my inventory.  I do not accept casual items (sweatshirts and t-shirts) or items that show excessive wear. When my quality standards are met, any rejection is based on the needs of our store and should not be taken personally.

Taylor, I remember this specific visit and urge you to try again, possibly before taking your items elsewhere.

text:
This used to be an OK place. But the last pair of shoes I bought there fell apart in a month, disintegrated. Pieces fell off as I walked.

And on another occasion, the person on duty was unimpressed that a pair of pants was missing a button.

Basically, it's a great place to go if you feel like being overcharged for clothing in poor condition.

name: Mandy Ennis
text: Really great curated pieces at fantastic prices. I get compliments all the time on pieces I've bought here.

name: Kelsi Greenlee
text: Repeat Performance has beautiful merchandise. I was able to find multiple pieces.  If you are looking for business or professional clothing for plus size, 1X-3X, I highly recommend browsing their store.  The prices range 15-25 dollars for their clothes, but the brands are top notch, Lane Bryant, Torrid, Jessica Simpson, Simply Bee.  If you looking to spend Poshmark prices, but don't want to pay the extra shipping and Poshmark fees, Stop here first.   They are more pricey than other consignment stores in the area, specifically Prattville's stores.

name: B Renae Batton
text: Customer service was amazing. This is a family owned and operated business and you can tell they enjoy what they do. The selection and prices are amazing, this is nothing like a thrift store. I consigned items today for the first time, and the process was so easy and painless. The employee made sure to explain how the whole process worked, and I left pleased and well informed about how the system works. They keep their Facebook page up to date with items they are currently taking and post lots of pictures of items they are currently selling. Would highly recommend to anyone looking to buy or sell.

name: Harley Russell
text: This was my second visit, and let's just say I won't be going back! First time around the staff (which was only 2 or 3 people) were very rude & un-welcoming. 2nd time around, same exact thing.

resp.text:
I'm sorry for your bad experience with our shop but, that is never ever what we want.
My daughter and I run the business,  yes it takes alot to run it. It's new and takes time to make enough money to even pay ourselves , less someone else.
I do know me and how I am and I am not an unwelcoming  person . I love my customers and they love us. I am here to help them sell there stuff for 50/50 where most place do 65 or 75 percent for themselves. I feel I'm here for the people,  not trying to be greedy by no means. Again I'm sorry for YOUR experience.
